data.name: Window_Responses_Label_CommandxResponse
data.value: Response on Command for X Seconds:

data.name: Code_Responses_ConnectMessage
data.value: Hey guys! I am a Bot and gonna control your NanoLeaf Lights! For help write '!nano help'.

data.name: Code_Responses_CommandDurationResponse
data.value: {username} changed the NanoLeaf Effect to {effect} for {duration} seconds.

data.name: Code_Responses_KeywordResponse
data.value: {username} said a magical Word and changed the NanoLeaf Effect to {effect}.

data.name: Window_ResponsesHelp_Text
data.value:
You can use different Placeholder Variables for your Response Messages:
You can choose between a 10 and 60 Minutes Timer for the Repeating Message. In a Later Version you can Disable it completely.
{username} This will be replaced with the Name of the User who caused the Change.
{effect} This will be replaced with the Name of the Effect that will displayed on the NanoLeafs.
{duration} - Only working on "Auto Restore Effect on Command" This will be replaced with the Time in Seconds - how long the Effect will be changed on the Nanoleafs.

data.name: Code_TriggerDetail_MessageBox_CPNoConnection
data.value: If you want to Create/Edit Channelpoints Trigger, please connect to Twitch Chat first!

data.name: Window_TriggerHelp_Text
data.value:
Trigger:
This is the "Type" of Event that, well ... triggers the Trigger. Twitch Events like "new Follower" or "new Subscriber" require a Duration in Seconds. If you get, for Example, a new Follower and you have a Trigger defined with 10 Seconds: The NanoLeaf will change to the desired Effect and change back to the previous Effect after 10 Seconds. The "Command" and "Cost" Field are disabled on this Type of Trigger. To Use the Twitch Channel Points you need to go to your Twitch Dashboard (https://dashboard.twitch.tv/u/yourtwitchname/community/channel-points) and create Own Rewards. To link the Reward to the Trigger simply redeem your desired Reward with your Streamer Account! User Color takes the Twitch Color of the User and paints one random Panel of the Nanoleafs in that Color! Command/Keyword: If you choose to let you Viewers play with your NanoLeaf Lights, take a try with Trigger Type "Command" or "Keyword! Command: A Command looks like this: !command You have a Prefix like ! and a command. You can Change the Prefix on the Bot Login Tab. The Message from the Viewer has to be exact like the Command. If you define !test as Command and the Viewer write !test123 or even !test 123 in Chat, the Trigger will not activate! (Please write the Command Name WITHOUT Prefix in the Box.) Keyword: In Difference to a Command, the Keyword can be a Single Message, Part of a Word or even a part of a whole Sentence. If you define the Keyword "test". The Trigger will activate at "test", "test123", "hellotestitsme" or even "This is a Test"! You can even add multiple Keywords for one Effect. Just separate them with a Comma - "fire,flames,hell" - "water,sea,ocean" Effect / Color: This is the Effect List pulled directly from your NanoLeaf Device. If you create new Effects with the NanoLeafs Mobile App, the new Effects get pulled on the Moment you Open the Trigger Detail Window! You can also choose a Solid Color from the Color Picker. Soundfile: Click on the Select Button and Browse to a Soundfile that should be played with this Trigger. (.mp3 and .wav are allowed) To Remove just delete the Path in the Textbox. Amount: You can define several Trigger with different Minimal Limits. If you create a Bits/Donation/Heartrate Trigger with 100 for Example ... a 99 Bits cheer will do nothing. If someone cheers 100+ Bits ... the Effect gets triggered. So you can do several Triggers for like 50+, 100+, 200+ etc ... Bits/Donations/HeartRate and Hosts. Duration & Cooldown: Duration and Cooldown in Seconds. Cooldown counts for each Trigger individually Brightness: You can specify the Brightness in % for each Trigger. Values can be between 0 and 100. VIP|Sub|Mod only: If you want to give ONLY VIP's, Subscribers or Moderators the possibility to use this Command or Keyword!

data.name: Window_TwitchLink_Single_Help
data.value:
Single Account - Broadcaster Setup (Recommended)
Use your Twitch Broadcaster Account to connect to the Chat and listen to the Messages and Twitch Events.
Pro: - Easy and Fast Setup. Con: - Your Account will post automated Messages into the Chat.

data.name: Window_TwitchLink_Double_Help
data.value:
Double Account - Bot Setup (Advanced)
Use a seperated Bot Account to Manage the Chat Messages and Connect your Broadcaster Account in the Background for the Twitch Events.
Pro: - Separate the automatic Messages to an extra Account. Con: - You need an extra Twitch Account.

data.name: Window_TwitchLink_Broadcaster_Permissions_Text
data.value:
With your Broadcaster Account we need some Permissions: - Read and Write in your Twitch Chat. - Read and Write in your Whispers. - Read Bit Information for your Channel. - Read Subscriber Information for your Channel. - Read and Write Channelpoint Redemptions for your Channel. - Read Hypetrain Information for your Channel.
To connect your Broadcaster Account:
Make sure that your logged into Twitch with your Broadcaster Account and then Click the Button below.

data.name: Window_TwitchLink_Bot_Permissions_Text
data.value:
With your Bot Account we need some Permissions: - Read and Write in your Twitch Chat. - Read and Write in your Whispers.
To connect your Bot Account:
Please enter the Bot's Twitch Username, make sure that your logged into Twitch with your Bot Account and then Click the Button below.
